result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig S. SHULTIS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig S. SHULTIS

NO CONTEST plea entered to the charge of felony bail jumping.  Convicted.
Sentencing is set for 04-21-16 at 1:30 p.m.
DNA sample ordered.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel.

Attorney Falk has filed a motion to withdraw stating that the defendant feels he is too busy to put adequate time into these cases.  The defendant would like to have Attorney Eric Pangburn represent him in these matters.  
The defendant is advised to go directly to the public defenders office to reapply in order to keep these matters moving.
Status conference is set for 06-17-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 06-23-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 2 position.

RE: Motion and Order to Withdraw.
Motion hearing at 05-11-2015 11:30 am
Status conference set for 06-17-15 @ 9:00 a.m. BR-3.

It is ordered that the signature bond shall be amdned with the following conditions:  Craig Shultis is allowed to travel to Florida for the purpose of visiting his wife, Amy Shultis, in the hospital.  The requirement to make a call to the jail daily is suspended.  All other conditions of the bond shall remain in effect.

Motion to Modify Bond.

Pre-Trial Conference scheduled for 1-26-2015 @ 9:30 a.m. BR-3.
Rescheduled from 01-27-2015.

Order Modifying Bail Conditions.
The Court ordered that the bail conditions are amended as follows:
1) defendant shall be allowed to leave the house for scheduled medical appointments, he may travel to the pharmacy to fill his prescriptions, and he may attend church services on Sundays at the Salvation Army location.  He shall call the Sheriff's Department prior to leaving for his medical appointments, trips to the pharmacy, or attending church services and he shall call the Sheriff's Department immediately upon his return from any of the preceding places.
2) defendant is required to call the Sheriff's Department and report in daily at 7:00 a.m. with a call back by the Sheriff's Department to verify he is at his residence.
3) Andrea Shultis may have a TracFone, with no internet or WI-FO capabilities to permit her to contact her mother in emergencies.
All other conditions of the bond shall remain unchanged.
Cover letter.
Letter from Attorney Falk to Judge Fox and ADA Prost.
Fax cover sheet with proposed order drafted by the court attached.
Letter from Attorney Falk to Judge Fox with revised order attached.
Letter from ADA Prost to Judge Fox.
Letter from Attorney Falk to JLF with proposed order attached.

BAIL MODIFICATION MOTION - 
Pretrial conference is adjourned to 01-27-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Jury trial is adjourned to 02-04-15 through 02-06-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 1 position.
The parties argue the motion.
The Court will allow the defendant to call in to the Sheriff's Department daily by 7:00 a.m. instead of physically checking in.
Detective Lecher is looking into ways to monitor a computer or tablet for the defendant's daughter to use for school.
The Court will allow the defendant to travel to the pharmacy and church on Sundays, but denies the request for travel to the grocery store.  The travel allowed will be with the same rules as with the medical appointments.
Attorney Falk to draft order.
Minutes.

Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial and Modify Bond.
Cover letter.
Motion hearing is set for 10-13-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Request for Adjournment.
Motion hearing is set for 10-10-14 at 8:45 a.m.

Motion to Modify Bond.

Third Supplemental Discovery Demand.

Court resets Jury Trial to 11-04-14 at 8:30 a.m. Position No. 1 (4 days)  Pre-trial/Motion hearing reset to 10-24-14 at 9:00 a.m.  
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL 
1) Defendant will be allowed to leave his house for medical reasons for himself and only if an emergency for family members.  Defendant is to call police department before and after. 
2) Defendant will be allowed to travel to his pharmacy for himself twice a month.  Defendant is to call police department before and after.  
3) Court denies this request.  Defendant is not allowed to travel to his usual grocery store.
4) This request is fine. 
5) Defendant's change of route is granted.  
Defense requests cell phones of Amy and his daughter.  Court denies the request.  
Minutes.
Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial and Modify Bond
Letter from Craig Shultis indicating telephone number.
Letter from Attorney Falk to Judge Fox
Letter from Attorney Falk to Judge Fox

Amended Order Modifying Bail
The Court hereby modifies that portion of its order to provide installation must take place by May 29, 2014 by 5:00 p.m.  
Fax Cover Sheet.
Order Modifying Bail.

Defendant in custody.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Court modifies defendant bail to $7,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions: 
1) Defendant is to have no contact with D.R.L., DOB: 08-19-1998 and no contact with her residence, her family or any premises she may occupy.
2) Defendant must report daily to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department between 3:30 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  He must travel west two blocks on Marshall to S. 8th Street,  one block north to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department.  He must call 920-683-4338 before and after.  
3) Any Internet enabled device must be turned into the Manitowoc City Police Departmentn by Wednesday, May 21, 2014, by 5:00 p.m.  Defendant has until Wednesday, May 21, 2014 by 5:00 p.m. to install a landline.  
4) Defendant is to remain in the premises of 609 Marshall Street at all other time.  
Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Testimony taken.  Court adjourns to 3:00 p.m. this afternoon.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-31-14 at 10:30 a.m.  
Minutes.
Marcus Falk, through public defender.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with D.R.L., DOB: 08-19-1988, no contact with her residence, her family or any premises she may occupy.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
